description: Inspector renders Constraints section for eligible node types (section/container/field/label/table/etc.)
Inspector hides pair-constraint controls for unsupported nodes (`document`, `page`)
Clicking `Set As Reference` stores selected node as active reference and displays it in inspector
Clicking `Clear Reference` removes active reference state and resets UI
Reference node remains active while selecting a different target node
Pair-constraint action buttons are disabled when no reference node is set
Pair-constraint action buttons are disabled when selected node equals reference node
Applying `align-left` creates a store constraint of type `align-left` with expected node ids
Applying `align-top` creates a store constraint of type `align-top` with expected node ids
Applying `match-width` creates a store constraint of type `match-width` with expected node ids
Applying `match-height` creates a store constraint of type `match-height` with expected node ids
Newly-created pair constraints default to configured strength policy (`strong`)
Adding duplicate same-type constraint for same ordered pair is blocked
Adding duplicate same-type constraint for reversed pair is blocked by normalized pair key
Constraint actions do not dispatch when either node is unsupported, missing, or not a same-parent pair
Inspector lists only constraints that involve the currently selected node
Constraint list rows show relation label and counterpart node name
Removing a constraint from inspector dispatches `removeConstraint` and updates list
Removing a constraint from inspector recomputes layout without stale lock behavior
Aspect-ratio toggle remains functional after Constraints panel refactor
Aspect-ratio constraints and pair constraints can coexist on separate nodes without regression
Canvas renders distinct visual state for active reference node
Canvas renders constrained-counterpart visual cues when selected node has pair constraints
Constraint conflict message appears with actionable guidance when solver reports conflict
Constraint conflict message clears after conflicting relation is removed
Undo after adding a pair constraint removes that constraint and restores prior layout
Redo after undoing pair-constraint add restores relation and aligned layout
Undo after removing a pair constraint restores the removed constraint
`exportWorkspace()` output contains authored pair constraints
`loadWorkspace()` rehydrates pair constraints and produces expected aligned geometry
Keyboard activation (Enter/Space) works for `Set As Reference` and `Clear Reference` controls
Keyboard activation works for each pair-constraint action button
Constraint remove action is keyboard operable for each list row
Constraints section emits stable automation IDs for reference controls and action buttons
Constraint list rows emit stable automation IDs including relation type and counterpart id
Applying layout presets while constraints exist does not crash and keeps store consistency
`Fit Section to Contents` continues to behave predictably when child nodes are pair-constrained
Moving one node in an `align-left` pair keeps both nodes aligned post-solve
Resizing one node in a `match-width` pair propagates width relationship post-solve
Deleting one node from a constrained pair auto-prunes dangling constraints and keeps inspector rendering stable on surviving node
End-to-end: author multiple pair constraints, save template, reload designer, and verify constraints persist
End-to-end: remove a persisted pair constraint and verify geometry updates after reload
Regression: existing preview workspace and layout verification tests remain green with constraints UI changes
Regression: aspect-ratio lock tests remain green after constraints-section unification
Clicking a constraint row counterpart control jumps selection to the related node
Counterpart jump control is keyboard-operable and moves selection to related node
Deleting a referenced node removes all constraints that reference that node from store state
`loadWorkspace()` with dangling constraint references auto-prunes invalid constraints during hydration
